column3: a former American Civil War major named Nathan Boynton first set eyes on the area that now bears his name. Boynton hailed from Port Huron
column4: Michigan. He was so impressed by the natural beauty of the year-round sunshine and pristine beaches
column5: he built the famous Boynton Hotel
column6: where he also spent winters with his family. The first settlers

column1: Boynton Beach was founded on September 26
column2: 1898 when Byrd Spilman Dewey and her husband Fred S. Dewey filed the original plat in the Dade County courthouse for the Town of Boynton. The town was incorporated in 1920 as the Town of Boynton. The name "Boynton Beach" was first used by a community that broke off from the Town of Boynton in 1931. In 1939
column3: that community changed its name to "Ocean Ridge" while The Town of Boynton took the name "Boynton Beach" in 1941.

column2: the Seaboard Air Line Railway entered what was then simply Boynton
column3: spurring land development a mile inland near the Seaboard station
column4: including the town's first planned subdivision
column5: Lake Boynton Estates. As land became more valuable
column6: areas along the Intracoastal Waterway and the Federal Highway in Boynton also saw housing developments. To the west
column7: many dairies were founded so that the Boynton area became the main milk supplier for Palm Beach County. By the 1970s
column8: the dairies were no longer profitable and these lands too were converted to housing developments.

column1: Boynton Beach Oceanfront Park is located just north of the original Boynton Hotel site. In 1921
column2: the Town of Boynton acquired the beach site from Lewis S. Howe by eminent domain for park and recreation purposes. The beach casino was built in 1928 and featured a large dining hall
column3: locker rooms and showers and residents used the casino for parties and social gatherings. The casino was demolished in 1967 and the property remained part of the beach park.

column2: Boynton Beach Oceanfront Park has been popular with residents and visitors alike. In the mid-1990s
column3: the park underwent a major renovation during which the boardwalk was rebuilt out of recycled plastic. Boynton Beach's Oceanfront Park was voted the best family beach in Palm Beach County by The Palm Beach Post in 2001. In 2011 the boardwalk was renovated again
column4: replacing the plastic with ipe (pronounced ee-pay) wood (commonly known as Brazilian walnut). In 2012 improvements were made to the buildings along the boardwalk
column5: including total refurbishment of the restrooms.

column1: Hurricane Wilma struck Boynton Beach on October 24
column3: causing widespread damage to homes and businesses. In 2006
column4: the city government authorized the demolition of the historic Seaboard rail station
column5: which had survived intact in private hands since passenger service to the station halted in 1971.

column1: 2006 saw an increase in gang-related violent crime. This mirrored a similar increase across Palm Beach County. A gang-related shooting that resulted in a death at the city's popular Boynton Beach Mall on Christmas Eve of 2006 caught the national attention on many news networks
column2: such as CBS. There were ten known operating gangs in the city as of 2007
column4: including the notorious South Florida Haitian Zoe Pound gang. As of 2009
column5: countywide gang violence had fallen three percent.On January 27
